name: Holiday Inn Express Berlin City Centre

reviews.title: great breakfast!
reviews.text: Great location to Anhalter Bahn subway stop (1/4 mile) and Potsdamer Platz (3/4 mile). Nice walk to Checkpoint Charlie and plenty of restaurants around. Staff very helpful and the breakfast was great. Room typical smallish European, but we didn't go to Berlin to stay in the hotel! Highly recommend, and take the subway--it's easy and quick.
Basic value for money hotel. Room small but adequate. Front desk staff reasonably helpful but they seem overworked. More businesslike than friendly.
reviews.title: Value for money, slightly out of the way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast choice adequate but dining room was small relative to the number of guests. Only quibble was the lifts - often quite full and could be a long wait.
reviews.title: Excellent value, excellent location

reviews.text: It is a 10 min walk to Potzdammer Platz so not as central as some other hotels. But it is a fairly priced clean hotel room for a couple of nights.
reviews.title: Good no-frills hotel for great price
At this hotel double-bookings occur, and they just transfer you to another!
reviews.text: Most has already been said, but this really is a good clean modern hotel in a great location at a great price. Plenty of choice at breakfast and great service from staff. Ate at the Argentinian/Mexican Steakhaus twice and the tapas was to die for. Little extras such as kettle in room, left luggage facilities and free internet all great.
From the buffet breakfasts, to the clean comfortable rooms with all the necessities, the Holiday Inn Express is a perfect place to stay whilst in Berlin.
reviews.title: Excellent Accommodation!

reviews.text: The staff were friendly and helpful when asking for directions and advice, the hotel is ideally located, just a short walk to Checkpoint Charlie and not far from the centre of Berlin.
reviews.title: Nice stay!

reviews.text: A bonus was the hotel bar open til late every evening, when you just want one more drink before retiring!
reviews.title: Lives up to its reputation

likes.disliked: — View of the wasteland next door

reviews.title: Great location
reviews.text: For the price I paid per night, this hotel was an excellent choice and would definately stay here again when next in Berlin.

reviews.title: Great stay at the Express by Holiday Inn
reviews.text: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express in Berlin for 3 nights. The hotel was very clean. The room was small but for the little amount of time we were there it was perfect. We got a great price. The breakfast was more than enough as well. The room was non-smoking and it was very quiet. We would definitely stay there again.
Stayed there in August 2007.
reviews.title: Excellent option

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As a good value, clean, well-located base for a trip to Berlin this hotel is hard to beat. 2 U-Bahn stations within 300m, 15 minutes stroll to Potsdamer Platz, friendly, helpful staff.
reviews.title: Clean Modern Hotel
fabulous value
reviews.text: If you want luxury go somewhere else but on a price / performance basis (particularly with an advance booking) this hotel represents an excellent option.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Express Inn Berlin,between 4th-8th of December 2006.
reviews.title: Comfortable and convenient

likes.disliked: — the floorplan of the bathroom area

reviews.title: Very Good Value
reviews.text: The reason for our visit was to explore Berlins Christmas Markets.

Stayed here in early May for 3 nights. We were able to walk to Topography of Terror, Checkpoint Charlie, and Potsdamerplatz easily even in the rain. We also walked to Brandenburg Gate and Reichstag which were about 20 minutes away. S-bahn stop was very close, which we were able to take to Potsdam with one change of trains. The hotel was very clean and modern - great value. There was a good Italian restaurant across the street (much cuter on the inside than outside) and several restaurants in Potsdamerplatz area. The block that the hotel is on is pretty quiet.
reviews.title: Convenient location, clean rooms

likes.disliked: — air conditioning did not work in early May

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had requested a twin bed room, but received a room with one full bed. After complaining, we were informed that there were no twin bed rooms available, but were sent a rollaway bed. The rollaway bed was actually pretty comfortable. The air conditioning was not working (maybe because it was still early May), but was able to keep the room cool with the window open. Unfortunately, there was a loose plastic strip outside the window that would make flapping noises when the wind blew, making it difficult to sleep. The room itself was very clean and had cable tv with CNN.
reviews.title: Value for Money

likes.disliked: — The bathroom - floor was permanently wet

reviews.text: The bathroom seemed new and clean as well. We must have had a handicapped accessible room, though, because the shower had no lip, just a drain in the floor and shower curtain. This caused most of the floor (even beyond the shower curtain) to get wet. We also had a chair in the shower, which got in the way of standing close to the shower head. However, the water pressure was excellent and there was plenty of hot water. The hair dryer is located outside of the bathroom (which I thought was a plus as I could blow dry my hair while someone else was in the bathroom) and was pretty powerful for a hotel hair dryer. It was also next to a full length mirror. I know that several rooms have a pull out couch, but ours did not.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.text: The breakfast was good by European standards. There was a variety of cold meats and cheeses, breads, fresh fruit, cereals, and juices. There was a toaster and a coffee/cappuccino/espresso/latte machine, which were both pluses. I noticed at breakfast that several tour bus groups were staying at this hotel (mostly German speaking, I believe). There was a computer in the lobby with free internet access, which was very nice and convenient.
reviews.title: Fit for purpose!

reviews.text: I think that for the price, it is a good hotel, and would recommend it if looking for a moderately priced hotel.
reviews.title: Nice hotel near the Center

aka: Holiday Inn Express Berlin City Centre Hotel Berlin
description: Stay smart! at the Express by Holiday Inn Hotel Berlin City Centre perfectly located at the Tempodrom and just 10 minutes walking distance from the new center of Berlin, the famous Potsdamer Platz and the Sony Center. The beautiful and grand Friedrichstrasse, Unter den Linden, Check Point Charlie and the storied Brandenburg Gate can easily be reached. Also the legendary boulevard Kurfuerstendamm, the well known department store KaDeWe and the Alexanderplatz are easily accessible. Great connections to both fair grounds and the airports Tegel (TXL) and Schoenefeld (SXF).After a good sleep in one of our 256 modern rooms, all with air condition, high speed internet and coffee and tea maker, start with our complimentary buffet breakfast, possibly enjoying our summer terrace. At our Business Corner in the lobby we offer Free WIFI.If on business, make a bargain with our BUSINESS PACKAGE or for leisure, buy tickets for Madame Tussauds, Legoland, Berlin Sightseeing or Concerts (Holiday on Ice, Lionel Richie, Robin Gibb) directly at the reception.Kids Stay Free Policy at the Express by Holiday Inn Hotel Berlin City Centre: Children under 18 years stay free in their parents' room using the sofa bed.Meet Smart! At Express by Holiday Inn Hotel Berlin City Centre meetings and trainings for up to 45 people will be a great success.
